Let $f(x)=\liminf_{n\to\infty} f_n(x)$ and let
$g_n(x)=\inf_{k\ge n} f_k(x)$ so that we have $$f(x) = \sup_n g_n(x).$$

As $g_n$ is an increasing sequence of measurable nonnegative functions
we can apply the monotone convergence Theorem to obtain
$$\int_X f\, d\mu = \lim_{n\to\infty} \int_X g_n\, d\mu.$$ On the other
hand, being $g_n\le f_n$, we conclude by observing
$$\lim_{n\to\infty} \int_X g_n\, d\mu 
= \liminf_{n\to\infty}\int_X g_n\, d\mu 
\le \liminf_{n\to\infty}\int_X f_n\, d\mu.$$
